Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX My XXXX, XXXX  XXXX Re : Urgent Request for Investigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information from Credit Reports Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally request your immediate intervention in addressing several violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by the major credit reporting agencies : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX. Despite numerous disputes, these agencies continue to report open accounts inaccurately, falsely claiming that these accounts have been verified as accurate. This situation has caused significant damage to my credit profile, and I have exhausted all direct channels with the credit reporting agencies to resolve these issues. I am now seeking your assistance to ensure that my rights are protected, and that these violations are addressed promptly. The specific FCRA violations I have identified include : # # # Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) : Reinvestigations of Disputed Information** Requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information and correct or delete inaccurate information. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Notice of Dispute** Requires that when a dispute is made, the credit reporting agency must notify the creditor or furnisher of the information being disputed. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Prompt Deletion of Inaccurate Information** Mandates the deletion of inaccurate information from a credit report if the information can not be verified. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 8 ) : Expedited Dispute Resolution** Provides that the credit reporting agency must resolve disputes in a timely manner, typically within 30 days. - **15 USC 1681b : Permissible Purpose of Reports** Limits the circumstances under which a credit report can be accessed, ensuring it is only used for permissible purposes such as credit evaluations. - **15 USC 1681e ( b ) : Accuracy and Integrity of Information** Requires that credit reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure that the information they report is accurate and complete. - **15 USC 1681g : Disclosures to Consumers** Grants consumers the right to request and obtain a copy of their credit report and information about their credit file, including information that is being disputed. - **15 USC 1681h : Disclosure of Sources of Information** Requires that when a consumer disputes an item, the credit reporting agency must provide the consumer with the sources of the information. - **15 USC 1681m : Notice of Negative Information** Requires that if negative information is used in a credit decision, the consumer must be notified. - **15 USC 1681n : Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance** Allows consumers to seek damages for willful noncompliance with FCRA requirements. - **15 USC 1681o : Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance** Allows for damages in cases of negligent noncompliance with FCRA provisions . # # # Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Violations - **15 USC 1692d : ** Prohibits debt collectors from engaging in conduct that harasses, oppresses, or abuses any person. - **15 USC 1692j : ** Prohibits furnishing certain deceptive forms. - **15 USC 1692g : ** Requires debt collectors to provide validation of debts. - **Section 807 : ** Prohibits the use of any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. # # # Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violations - **15 USC 1601 et seq. : TILA Disclosure Requirements** If any inaccuracies or discrepancies in the terms and disclosures of the accounts are found, they must be corrected immediately. # # # Additional Violations - **18 USC 1028 ( a ) ( 7 ) : ** Addresses issues related to identity theft. - **15 USC 1681a ( k ) ( B ) ( iv ) ( ll ) : ** Relates to the misuse of personal information. # # # Request for Expedited Deletion Under FCRA I demand the CFPB ensure these agencies comply with the following : - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) : Reinvestigations of Disputed Information** Upon receiving my dispute, the credit reporting agency must reinvestigate the disputed information. If the investigation reveals inaccuracies, the information must be corrected or deleted from my report. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ) : Prompt Deletion of Inaccurate Information** This section requires that any unverifiable or inaccurate information must be promptly deleted from my credit report. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 8 ) : Expedited Dispute Resolution** I request expedited handling of this dispute as provided under the FCRA. P # # # Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Violations - **15 USC 1692g ( b ) : Validation of Debts** I have disputed the validity of the debts in question. Until the debt collector provides proper validation, they must cease all collection activities. Despite my request for validation, no verification has been provided, and thus, these accounts must be removed from my report. # # # Specific Information to be Corrected : # # # # Erroneous Accounts : 1. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 2. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 3. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 4. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 5. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : # # # # Erroneous Inquiries : 1. 2. 3. 4. # # # # Erroneous addresses : 1. 2. 3. 4. # # # # Erroneous name spelling : 1. 2. 3. 4. Incorrect employment 1. 2. 3. 4. I demand that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau take immediate action to rectify these violations and ensure that my credit reports are corrected to reflect accurate and verifiable information. The continuous errors and violations have caused significant distress and potential financial harm. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, Add your name here. XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. Unless the creditor has adopted it reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including information required by ( Section 1637 ( b ) ) Is mail or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before payment due date.

There are certain clear and conspicuous disclosures that this creditor was supposed to provide me with 21 days prior to my statement due date that I didn't receive which is a violation of 15 US code 1666b.

Also 18 US code 8 states that the obligation of this day is already paid for by the United States. So, this credit balance is in excess of {$1.00} And the law clearly states that the treatment of any credit violence is supposed to be refunded upon the request of the consumer so I would also like to request my refund.

This creditor is in violation of 15 US code 1692 J for furnishing certain deceptive forms creating a false belief into consumer that a person other than the creditor of such consumer is participating in the collection of or in an attempt to allegedly owes such creditor, when in fact such person is not so participating. Any person who violates this section shall be liable to the same extent and in the same manner as a debt collector is liable under ( Section 1692 K ) For failure to comply with a provision of this subchapter.

As the victim of identity theft, I am requesting that these accounts be removed from my credit reports within 4 days, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Regulation V. 

Specific Allegations : Inaccurate information on my credit reports : The accounts listed above are not mine and were opened without my consent. 
Failure to investigate and correct the error : Experian and XXXX have failed to properly investigate and correct the error despite my repeated requests. 
Violation of FCRA : Experian and XXXX have violated the FCRA by not removing the disputed accounts from my credit reports within 4 days as required.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I am writing to dispute the collection account referenced above, which appears on my credit report. I am a victim of identity theft, and this account is not mine. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and request its removal if it can not be verified. The account in question was opened fraudulently using my personal information without my knowledge or consent. 

Upon contacting the collection agency to dispute this account, I was informed that they have the incorrect name associated with the account. Despite this acknowledgment, the collection account continues to appear on my credit report, causing significant harm to my creditworthiness. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and have it corrected or removed if it can not be verified. The collection agency 's failure to correct this error and the continued presence of this incorrect information on my credit report is a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. 


The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I request that you : 1. Conduct an investigation into this matter.

2. Remove this fraudulent collection account from my credit report immediately.

3. Cease all collection activities related to this account.

4. Provide written confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report.

I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies comply with their obligations under the FCRA. This inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report promptly.

Please investigate this matter and instruct the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies to remove the incorrectly associated collection account from my credit report. I request a written confirmation once the investigation is complete and the account has been removed.

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an open account with XXXX since 2017. Unfortunately, there were some times that I fell behind due to a financial setback when I was in college that resulted in late payments. Despite this challenge, I diligently managed to catch up. However, I have discovered that this account is currently reflecting as negative account activity on my credit report. 
This misleading information is impeding my ability to pursue a significant milestone in my life- buying a home. Maintaining good credit is of utmost importance to me, and I am eager to rectify this situation. I firmly believe in taking responsibility for my financial obligations and view good credit as non-negotiable. Now, I am compelled to request XXXX to remove the damaging information from my reports. I am aware of the importance of adhering to policies, but I also firmly believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to make amends for past mistakes. I firmly believe that the repercussions of unforeseen circumstances should not have a perpetual impact on one 's financial standing. People do deserve a goodwill or second chance. This is unfair that this information has to linger for years.

I am writing to express my outrage and formally dispute the late payments reported on my Experian credit report for the months of XXXX and XXXX of 2021 on my XXXX XXXX account, number XXXX. This unauthorized reporting of late payments is not only incorrect but also a direct violation of my privacy rights and applicable consumer protection laws, specifically 15 USC 1666b.

**Violation of 15 USC 1666b** Under 15 USC 1666b , creditors are mandated to provide timely notice to consumers at least 21 days before the payment due date. I did not receive such notice, making these late payment reports not only invalid but also illegal. The lack of proper notification has directly resulted in significant and undue harm to my credit standing.

**Demand for Immediate Action** I demand the immediate and unconditional removal of these erroneous late payments from my credit report. XXXX XXXX 's failure to comply with 15 USC 1666b has caused unwarranted damage to my creditworthiness, affecting my ability to secure credit, employment, and other financial opportunities. 

**Privacy Violation** Furthermore, this account information has been reported to Experian without my explicit consent, infringing upon my right to privacy. The unauthorized dissemination of my financial data is unacceptable and must be rectified without delay.

The presence of these unauthorized accounts on my credit report has caused me significant distress and uncertainty about the security of my personal information. I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the unrecognized accounts for your reference.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Trafficking Block Request To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to advise that I am a victim of trafficking. For your convenience and reference, I have attached supporting documents that substantiate my claim. The information listed below, that is currently listed on my credit report is a result of that trafficking Please block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. This section provides the right to request the deletion of information from a credit report as a result of trafficking.

Per 605C - 2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer.

The Bureau is adopting several amendments to Regulation V to implement new section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ,1 added by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year XXXX XXXX XXXX NDAA ) .2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer reporting agency.3 Under section 605C, the Bureau is required to issue implementing regulations within 180 days of the enactment of the XXXX NDAA XXXX Section 605C is effective 30 days after the Bureau issues its final implementing regulations. 
BILLING CODE : XXXX BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION 12 CFR Part 1022 [ Docket No. CFPBXXXX ] XXXX  XXXX Prohibition on Inclusion of Adverse Information in Consumer Reporting in Cases of Human Trafficking ( Regulation V ) Please send me notification of the actions taken. I greatly appreciate your prompt expedited action to this matter.

After speaking with the customer service department it has been identified that their app doesn't reflect what their online statements reflect. For the past 3 months I have been paying the amount owed as shown on the telephone app. In the month of XX/XX/year> my car payment was reported last due to their app showing a payment of {$550.00} was due I made a payment of {$560.00} thinking my account was paid as agreed. I spoke with an agent who advised that I must pay the loan agreement amount of {$560.00} opposed to what their system shows on their phone app. This information is misleading and confusing as a customer. I thought that I was paying what was owed due to what their system reflects just to find out that I can't trust the amount noted on the app. I also was never called as they had the incorrect number listed for myself and my husband, however in the app my phone information is listed correctly as when I need to verify my account they text me on the correct number to allow access to my account. I am also not receiving the hardcopy statements hence as to why I go strictly off of what the app reflects. I have paid the lesser amount as shown on my account in XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> as based off what the app payment amount due reflected and was not penalized for paying less than the {$560.00}. As per XXXX from XXXX call center she advised that the {$560.00} or more must be paid regardless to what the payment amount shows on the statements or app, which is very conflicting to me as a customer. I paid {$540.00} in XXXX {$550.00} in XXXX and {$560.00} in XXXX. Any payment system offered by XXXX should always mirror and reflect what my statements show and reflect {$560.00} is due every month, however XXXX system fluctuates every month something different.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to you because there are some negative items in my credit profile, but I have not confirmed or accepted that these are accurate. I dispute these claims and demand that any negative information be removed from the reports immediately. The claims that this information in my report is negative, untrue, incorrect, incomplete, untimely, and not verifiable are unsubstantiated. I have yet to be provided physical verifiable proof that the claims of negativity within my report are true. After reviewing my report, there are several deviations from mandatory reporting standards therefore the data in my report can not be accurate and complete! With that said, I refute your allegations and challenge you to provide proof that you have the right to report this incomplete negative information about me. Document that you have complied with the reporting requirements, and report without any deviations. If you have not complied with the requirements or there are any negative aspects below that have been challenged, you must remove them from my report. Per 15 U.S.C 1681e Whenever a consume reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

According to 12 CFR Part 1022 ( Regulation V ) requires furnishers to : Furnish information concerning accounts or other relationships with a consumer that has integrity. 
Furnish information about accounts or other relationships with a consumer that is accurate. 
XXXX - XXXX reasonable investigations of consumer disputes According to XXXX, in order to make a lawful report, you must follow the Metro 2 compliance standards.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Acct Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

( XXXX ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agencyshall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

Delete this collection Account immediately because of violation of 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) & ( b ), 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ) & ( ii ), and 15 USC 1681e ( b ).

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. 

15 USC 6801 says that I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared!!! The law states, " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 USC 1681 section 602a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states, " Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. 

Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures! My privacy rights and identity have been stolen! That also means that the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) was violated! This account is an adverse item they are reporting without my permission which is against the law and hurting my ability to obtain credit! Please remove this account immediately!! See the attached documents.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this formal complaint under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to address the violation of my federally protected consumer rights by the following accounts : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The aforementioned accounts, identified by Account name : # XXXX, have egregiously violated my rights as outlined in the FCRA : 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. states that I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 emphasizes that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Section states that no consumer reporting agency may include certain adverse items of information in a consumer report, particularly any other adverse item of information that antedates the report by more than seven years.

Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) stipulates that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

These violations not only compromise my privacy but also infringe upon the fundamental principles outlined in the FCRA. I request a thorough investigation into this matter and appropriate action to rectify these breaches. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I am writing to dispute the collection account referenced above, which appears on my credit report. I am a victim of identity theft, and this account is not mine. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and request its removal if it can not be verified. The account in question was opened fraudulently using my personal information without my knowledge or consent. 

Upon contacting the collection agency to dispute this account, I was informed that they have the incorrect name associated with the account. Despite this acknowledgment, the collection account continues to appear on my credit report, causing significant harm to my creditworthiness. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and have it corrected or removed if it can not be verified. The collection agency 's failure to correct this error and the continued presence of this incorrect information on my credit report is a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. 


The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I request that you : 1. Conduct an investigation into this matter.

2. Remove this fraudulent collection account from my credit report immediately.

3. Cease all collection activities related to this account.

4. Provide written confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report.

I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies comply with their obligations under the FCRA. This inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report promptly.

Please investigate this matter and instruct the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies to remove the incorrectly associated collection account from my credit report. I request a written confirmation once the investigation is complete and the account has been removed. 

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute several unauthorized hard inquiries that have appeared on my credit report. I did not authorize these inquiries, and they are negatively impacting my credit score and overall financial health. I respectfully request that these inquiries be removed from my credit report immediately. The hard inquiries in question are as follows XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX which is pass the statue for reporting, US SM Bus Admin ODS is pass the statue for reporting. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( c ), a credit reporting agency may only include hard inquiries on a consumer report if they were made for a permissible purpose, such as an application for credit initiated by the consumer. Since I did not authorize these inquiries, they do not meet the criteria set forth by the FCRA. Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) obligates credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation when a consumer disputes the accuracy of any information on their credit report. I am formally requesting that you conduct such an investigation to verify the legitimacy of these inquiries.

( XXXX ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agencyshall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address an issue with the reporting of my XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX credit card account, which was charged off and subsequently sold to a debt collection agency, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX and XXXX : Charge-Off and Sale : The account was charged off in XX/XX/year>, with a balance of {$4200.00}. Subsequently, this debt was presumably sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I did not receive any documentation from both XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX other than a notice in my customer portal and spam emails from XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX : Despite the sale of this debt, my credit report continues to show the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX account as charged off each month for XXXX months without indicating that the debt has been sold. This is reflected in both my XXXX credit report and other credit reports. 

Request for Action : I respectfully request that the following actions be taken to ensure accurate reporting : Update Account Status : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX should update the status of my account to indicate that it has been sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. This update should reflect that XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is no longer the responsible party for this debt. 
Correct Credit Report Entries : Ensure that all credit bureaus ( XXXX, TransUnion, XXXX ) receive the correct information about the sale of the account. This includes removing the repeated " charged off '' status from each month following the sale. 
Confirmation of Update : Please provide written confirmation once these updates have been made to my credit report. 

Ensuring that my credit report accurately reflects the current status of my account is essential for my financial recovery and creditworthiness. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and await your confirmation of the requested updates.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Please see the attached as evidence on both the XXXX XXXX XXXX and the XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX negatively reported accounts. 
All three CRAs have stated they verified the XXXX XXXX TAB account and have found me to be lying and, through FCRA investigation requirements, have concluded, based on documentation, account, and billing statements, specific inquiry into my incessant claims of having on XX/XX/XXXX reported immediately to the XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of fraudulent transactions due to identity theft, a listing of the XXXX hotels that are under the same parent company, the employees involved, and how the fraud occurred, for which each time over XXXX months I called to check status of investigation and holding these fraudulent actors accountable. I have spoken twice with XXXX XXXX XXXX, as requested via email. Both times, the following was stated to me ; We were never asked, inquired about, nor provided any documentation on the fraudulent occurrences due to identity theft because the CRAs only requested verification of the account being obtained. On my own and for me, so because you filed complaints through the CFPB, which has no bearing on us, and because the XXXX was requesting verification of your opening the account as owner, we will not provide you or them with any further information. It would have been best if you had come only through us, but because you didnt, we are not offering any additional information about the fraud due to identity theft transactions. I am requesting the CFPB either request the time-stamped documentation, billing, and transactional history, the reporting history, and the information requested by each CRA of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to the fraudulent transactions due to identity theft, as each has stated repeatedly they have acted by FCRA guidelines and have determined to leave this negatively reported dishonest, fraudulent account on my credit file when the original creditor states they have neither requested nor received such information, simply verification the account was my own. I am requesting the CFPB to investigate these investigative processes as well as refer this case to the XXXX XXXX, which can investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX. All I am doing is further stating that if this is commissioned and if I am found to have been dishonest, misled, misrepresented, and committed fraud on a federal site against a federal agency, I will be criminally charged and held fully accountable. I attest again to the CFPB and the CRAs here, as an oath, XXXX XXXX TAB is knowingly, willfully, and intentionally committing additional fraud and has stated my filing complaints has sealed my fate. However, I am sure of my telling the truth, which in turn makes me sure that the CRAs have not investigated, have not had the time-stamped documentation, statements, transactional history, etc., called for under FCRA, XXXX this account would have long ago been deleted. Attached is the proof of mailing XXXX priority receipt all documents to XXXX XXXX inclusive of the FTC, CFPB complaints, the Notice XXXX XXXX and obligations of Furnishers with the returned file torn open and then refused, which was admitted to. 
On the second negatively reported account, LVNV and Credit XXXX, I also have attached proof of their both receiving the same file PRIOR to then reporting negatively against FCRA guidelines, and further, a Letter of Verification from XXXX XXXX for all CRAs to delete all negative accounts connected to Credit XXXX. This is being refused. 

While XXXX and Equifax have demonstrated professionalism, respect, and compliance with the FCRA and the CFPB and have been communicative, efficient, and 95 % fair while adhering to laws, regulations, and guidelines, I request a thorough investigation into these XXXX accounts. I am seeking a conclusive outcome that addresses any potential criminal implications for myself and the conduct of the XXXX CRAs and XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX has in total, and with total disregard for FCRA, the CFPB, myself, and likely thousands of other consumers like myself who should unite ; I am requesting a full review, investigation, and an investigation into the comprehensive, willful, intentional neglect, actions, and harm imposed on myself through unlawful reporting, inaccurate systemic inaccurate and false reporting, failure to investigate, to give an adequate response, failure to communicate, and a willful disregard of FCRA, the FTC, CFPB guidelines and oversight as is pervasive throughout my account, and is most likely a strong, reasonable conclusive objectively derived necessitation for a comprehensive investigation as their having a systemic, foundational, and operational deficiency that possibly hundreds of thousands citizens of specific statuses, economic levels, and class of our society is facing daily, and the overall economic harm being caused to our country. When XXXX months later, after multiple accounts unlawfully stating accounts as XXXX in chapter XXXX bankruptcy while still providing amounts owed, past due, negative delinquencies ; While taking a title-loan that was closed and written off over a year ago with an original debt and total debt owed even according to the creditor of {$3800.00} and less than XXXX months later, XXXX intentionally XXXX credit by taking that amount up by a 300 % interest rate to now show me owing over {$11000.00} and growing every month, increasing debt amount, the amount owed and being repeatedly disputed as an unlawful, intentional fraud to cause my credit and financial standing continued harm is not operational malfunction at a single level ; it is along with all other unlawful actions evidence of a pervasive systematic unfair, improper act against most likely the lower 30 % of our country. If XXXX were to ask the original creditor what amount would satisfy the debt, and the answer is {$3800.00}, why is XXXX stating to all possible creditors that the number is nearly 300 % higher and growing? How does XXXX knowingly and intentionally leave a fraudulent account due to fraud on my report for over XXXX years, knowing it was removed from every other CRA immediately, inclusive of XXXX, and then placed back on my credit file? Especially after XXXX XXXX, XXXX of the creditors from XXXX, has agreed it is unlawful and incorrect? Why does XXXX report completely inaccurate information on almost every account? Is it objectively clear, and refuses to fix it? Why does XXXX not once mail out a copy of my credit report, an explanation of an investigation, and never once find that a single dispute results in a finding in my favor, even when clearly evident? XXXX has never once investigated under FCRA as guided and has never once responded to a single complaint, dispute, or factual unlawful act by repairing it. XXXX XXXX was sent pages of substantial, incessant, harmful, unlawful, and inaccurate complaints, to which they responded the issues had already been raised. Nothing about the issues being addressed, nothing about correcting the issues, and I am requesting the CFPB, given my persistence in bringing forward significant, numerous, continual unlawful, anti-regulatory, actions that have caused me financial harm at the highest level, simply request XXXX to provide time-stamped documentation, tangible information, a listing of what measures XXXX used in investigating issues raised and an explanation why they repeatedly act unlawfully, incompetently, and with such disregard to FCRA in the pursuit of harming an entire status of class in our society and review them from a large segment of our citizenry that is devastating the financial strength, capability, and increasing inequitably the challenges when this segment and class of our society is the least empowered already.

Another property mentioned in our divorce decree, a lake home referenced in line XXXX, was also sold using my credit until the date of its sale. His current wife, XXXX XXXX, fraudulently impersonated me and signed the papers to sell the property, acting as me. Despite my name being on the debt and mortgage until the date of sale, the sale documents were drafted in her name, not mine. I had to contact the title company to obtain the sale records to close on my current home and became of aware of this fraudulent action. I want no ties to this type of behavior nor the repercussions of other 's fraud.

I urge you to rectify this issue immediately by removing these defaults from my credit score. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer.

15 USC 6801 says that I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared!!! The law states, " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 USC 1681 section 602a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states, " Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. 

XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion are not maintaining reasonable procedures! My privacy rights and identity have been stolen! That also means that the Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) was violated! This account is an adverse item they are reporting without my permission which is against the law and hurting my ability to obtain credit! Please remove this account immediately!! See the attached documents.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an open account with XXXX since 2017. Unfortunately, there were some times that I fell behind due to a financial setback when I was in college that resulted in late payments. Despite this challenge, I diligently managed to catch up. However, I have discovered that this account is currently reflecting as negative account activity on my credit report. 
This misleading information is impeding my ability to pursue a significant milestone in my life- buying a home. Maintaining good credit is of utmost importance to me, and I am eager to rectify this situation. I firmly believe in taking responsibility for my financial obligations and view good credit as non-negotiable. Now, I am compelled to request XXXX to remove the damaging information from my reports. I am aware of the importance of adhering to policies, but I also firmly believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to make amends for past mistakes. I firmly believe that the repercussions of unforeseen circumstances should not have a perpetual impact on one 's financial standing. People do deserve a goodwill or second chance. This is unfair that this information has to linger for years.

I am submitting this formal complaint under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to address the violation of my federally protected consumer rights by the following accounts : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  The aforementioned accounts, identified by Account name : # XXXX, have egregiously violated my rights as outlined in the FCRA : 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. states that I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 emphasizes that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) Section states that no consumer reporting agency may include certain adverse items of information in a consumer report, particularly any other adverse item of information that antedates the report by more than seven years.

Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) stipulates that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

These violations not only compromise my privacy but also infringe upon the fundamental principles outlined in the FCRA. I request a thorough investigation into this matter and appropriate action to rectify these breaches. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I thought that I was paying what was owed due to what their system reflects just to find out that I can't trust the amount noted on the app. I also was never called as they had the incorrect number listed for myself and my husband, however in the app my phone information is listed correctly as when I need to verify my account they text me on the correct number to allow access to my account. I am also not receiving the hardcopy statements hence as to why I go strictly off of what the app reflects. I have paid the lesser amount as shown on my account in XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> as based off what the app payment amount due reflected and was not penalized for paying less than the {$560.00}. As per XXXX from XXXX call center she advised that the {$560.00} or more must be paid regardless to what the payment amount shows on the statements or app, which is very conflicting to me as a customer. I paid {$540.00} in XXXX {$550.00} in XXXX and {$560.00} in XXXX. Any payment system offered by XXXX should always mirror and reflect what my statements show and reflect {$560.00} is due every month, however XXXX system fluctuates every month something different.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account Name : XXXX XXXX / XXXX Account # XXXX According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

( XXXX ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agencyshall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
o Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the inaccurate reporting of my mortgage account on my credit report. The mortgage account in question has been paid in full and closed following the sale of my house, yet it is still being reported as open and late. 

The details of the mortgage account are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The mortgage was fully paid off on XX/XX/year> and there were no late payments at the time of closing. However, my credit report inaccurately shows this account as open and late, which is incorrect and adversely affecting my credit score. 
I request that you immediately correct my credit report to reflect the accurate status of this account as closed and paid in full, with no late payments. This correction should be made pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 611, which requires credit reporting agencies to ensure the accuracy of the information they report. 

Please confirm receipt of this letter and notify me once the correction has been made by providing an updated copy of my credit report. I expect this matter to be resolved within the 30-day period as mandated by the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX My XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX Re : Urgent Request for Investigation and Removal of Inaccurate Information from Credit Reports Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to formally request your immediate intervention in addressing several violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by the major credit reporting agencies : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. Despite numerous disputes, these agencies continue to report open accounts inaccurately, falsely claiming that these accounts have been verified as accurate. This situation has caused significant damage to my credit profile, and I have exhausted all direct channels with the credit reporting agencies to resolve these issues. I am now seeking your assistance to ensure that my rights are protected, and that these violations are addressed promptly. The specific FCRA violations I have identified include : # # # Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations - XXXX*15 USC 1681i ( a ) : Reinvestigations of Disputed Information** Requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information and correct or delete inaccurate information. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Notice of Dispute** Requires that when a dispute is made, the credit reporting agency must notify the creditor or furnisher of the information being disputed. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) : Prompt Deletion of Inaccurate Information** Mandates the deletion of inaccurate information from a credit report if the information can not be verified. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 8 ) : Expedited Dispute Resolution** Provides that the credit reporting agency must resolve disputes in a timely manner, typically within 30 days. - **15 USC 1681b : Permissible Purpose of Reports** Limits the circumstances under which a credit report can be accessed, ensuring it is only used for permissible purposes such as credit evaluations. - **15 USC 1681e ( b ) : Accuracy and Integrity of Information** Requires that credit reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure that the information they report is accurate and complete. - **15 USC 1681g : Disclosures to Consumers** Grants consumers the right to request and obtain a copy of their credit report and information about their credit file, including information that is being disputed. - **15 USC 1681h : Disclosure of Sources of Information** Requires that when a consumer disputes an item, the credit reporting agency must provide the consumer with the sources of the information. - **15 USC 1681m : Notice of Negative Information** Requires that if negative information is used in a credit decision, the consumer must be notified. - **15 USC 1681n : Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance** Allows consumers to seek damages for willful noncompliance with FCRA requirements. - **15 USC 1681o : Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance** Allows for damages in cases of negligent noncompliance with FCRA provisions . # # # Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Violations - **15 USC 1692d : ** Prohibits debt collectors from engaging in conduct that harasses, oppresses, or abuses any person. - **15 USC 1692j : ** Prohibits furnishing certain deceptive forms. - **15 USC 1692g : ** Requires debt collectors to provide validation of debts. - **Section 807 : ** Prohibits the use of any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. # # # Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violations - **15 USC 1601 et seq. : TILA Disclosure Requirements** If any inaccuracies or discrepancies in the terms and disclosures of the accounts are found, they must be corrected immediately. # # # Additional Violations - **18 USC 1028 ( a ) ( 7 ) : ** Addresses issues related to identity theft. - **15 USC 1681a ( k ) ( B ) ( iv ) ( ll ) : ** Relates to the misuse of personal information. # # # Request for Expedited Deletion Under FCRA I demand the CFPB ensure these agencies comply with the following : - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) : Reinvestigations of Disputed Information** Upon receiving my dispute, the credit reporting agency must reinvestigate the disputed information. If the investigation reveals inaccuracies, the information must be corrected or deleted from my report. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ) : Prompt Deletion of Inaccurate Information** This section requires that any unverifiable or inaccurate information must be promptly deleted from my credit report. - **15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 8 ) : Expedited Dispute Resolution** I request expedited handling of this dispute as provided under the FCRA. P # # # Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Violations - **15 USC 1692g ( b ) : Validation of Debts** I have disputed the validity of the debts in question. Until the debt collector provides proper validation, they must cease all collection activities. Despite my request for validation, no verification has been provided, and thus, these accounts must be removed from my report. # # # Specific Information to be Corrected : # # # # Erroneous Accounts : 1. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 2. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 3. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 4. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : 5. Account name : Account number : Date opened : Balance : # # # # Erroneous Inquiries : 1. 2. 3. 4. # # # # Erroneous addresses : 1. 2. 3. 4. # # # # Erroneous name spelling : 1. 2. 3. 4. Incorrect employment 1. 2. 3. 4. I demand that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau take immediate action to rectify these violations and ensure that my credit reports are corrected to reflect accurate and verifiable information. The continuous errors and violations have caused significant distress and potential financial harm. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, Add your name here. XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your bureau and company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 6 letter and dispute I have sent to the creditors along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this credit bureau and credit companies are violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 6th notice to the bureau and the creditor companies notifying them that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected and this credit bureau or creditors are not honoring my identity theft claim. My 7th notice of litigation will be a lawsuit suing this credit bureau and all these creditors, these companies and credit bureau did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, Im going to sue for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from creditors, and assisting to furnish wrong and fraudulent accounts. I demand all accounts and inquiries be removed as soon as possible. 

Specifically, I refer to the following entries : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$37000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$53000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX {$500.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$1000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$2500.00} XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX {$530.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$410.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$970.00} XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681b , consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, such as with the consumers written consent or in connection with a credit transaction initiated by the consumer. I did not provide my consent for the release or sharing of my personal information related to these accounts, nor did I initiate any credit transactions with the entities listed.

Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c requires that consumer reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of consumer information. The unauthorized disclosure of my information not only violates this statute but also exposes me to potential identity theft and other forms of financial harm.

I request that you take the following actions : 1. **Conduct an immediate investigation** : As required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I request that you investigate these unauthorized entries on my credit report.
2. **Remove the disputed entries** : If the investigation finds these entries were indeed unauthorized, they must be promptly removed from my credit report.

3. **Provide written confirmation** : Send me a written confirmation that the unauthorized entries have been removed from my credit report.

4. **Send an updated credit report** : Provide me with a current copy of my credit report to verify the corrections.

Enclosed are copies of the relevant documents, including my recent credit report highlighting the disputed entries and any supporting documents that substantiate my claim.

Please consider this letter as a formal complaint and take all necessary actions to resolve this matter within the 30-day timeframe stipulated by the FCRA. Failure to do so may result in further legal action to protect my rights. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Trafficking Block Request To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to advise that I am a victim of trafficking. For your convenience and reference, I have attached supporting documents that substantiate my claim. The information listed below, that is currently listed on my credit report is a result of that trafficking Please block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. This section provides the right to request the deletion of information from a credit report as a result of trafficking.

Per 605C - 2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer. 
The Bureau is adopting several amendments to Regulation V to implement new section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ,1 added by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year XXXX XXXX XXXX NDAA ) .2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer reporting agency.3 Under section 605C, the Bureau is required to issue implementing regulations within 180 days of the enactment of the XXXX NDAA . Section 605C is effective 30 days after the Bureau issues its final implementing regulations. 
BILLING CODE : XXXX BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION 12 CFR Part 1022 [ Docket No. CFPBXXXX ] XXXX XXXX Prohibition on Inclusion of Adverse Information in Consumer Reporting in Cases of Human Trafficking ( Regulation V ) Please send me notification of the actions taken. I greatly appreciate your prompt expedited action to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Customer number XXXX Case number XXXX LEXISNEXIS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : REQUEST LETTER TO REMOVE INACCURATE INFORMATION To Whom It May Concern, Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. Going over my report, I have found it has errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : 1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXX v. XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, at XXXX ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means 'to make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, '' ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXX 's XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) ) ; XXXX ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq.

Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my consumer report. See. Exhibit A. 
Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items 1 am disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary. 
I know that your company will need some sort of verification to prove my identity. My information is clearly shown below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AZ XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent this letter via certified mail to ensure this matter is resolved within the required thirty ( 30 ) day window so as to avoid any violation of the FCRA. Finally, please send me a copy of the changed consumer report at the earliest. 
Thank you for your assistance in this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your bureau and company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 6 letter and dispute I have sent to the creditors along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this credit bureau and credit companies are violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 6th notice to the bureau and the creditor companies notifying them that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected and this credit bureau or creditors are not honoring my identity theft claim. My 7th notice of litigation will be a lawsuit suing this credit bureau and all these creditors, these companies and credit bureau did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, Im going to sue for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from creditors, and assisting to furnish wrong and fraudulent accounts. I demand all accounts and inquiries be removed as soon as possible. 

Specifically, I refer to the following entries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 2. Wells Fargo Auto XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681b , consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, such as with the consumers written consent or in connection with a credit transaction initiated by the consumer. I did not provide my consent for the release or sharing of my personal information related to these accounts, nor did I initiate any credit transactions with the entities listed. 

Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c requires that consumer reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of consumer information. The unauthorized disclosure of my information not only violates this statute but also exposes me to potential identity theft and other forms of financial harm. 

I request that you take the following actions : 1. **Conduct an immediate investigation** : As required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I request that you investigate these unauthorized entries on my credit report. 
XXXX. **Remove the disputed entries** : If the investigation finds these entries were indeed unauthorized, they must be promptly removed from my credit report. 
XXXX. **Provide written confirmation** : Send me a written confirmation that the unauthorized entries have been removed from my credit report. 
XXXX. **Send an updated credit report** : Provide me with a current copy of my credit report to verify the corrections. 

Enclosed are copies of the relevant documents, including my recent credit report highlighting the disputed entries and any supporting documents that substantiate my claim. 

Please consider this letter as a formal complaint and take all necessary actions to resolve this matter within the XXXX timeframe stipulated by the FCRA. Failure to do so XXXX result in further legal action to protect my rights. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your bureau and company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 6 letter and dispute I have sent to the creditors along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this credit bureau and credit companies are violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 6th notice to the bureau and the creditor companies notifying them that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected and this credit bureau or creditors are not honoring my identity theft claim. My 7th notice of litigation will be a lawsuit suing this credit bureau and all these creditors, these companies and credit bureau did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was XXXX for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, Im going to sue for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from creditors, and assisting to furnish wrong and fraudulent accounts. I demand all accounts and inquiries be removed as soon as possible. 

Specifically, I refer to the following entries : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$37000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$53000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX {$500.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$1000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$2500.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX {$530.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$410.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX {$970.00} XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681b , consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, such as with the consumers written consent or in connection with a credit transaction initiated by the consumer. I did not provide my consent for the release or sharing of my personal information related to these accounts, nor did I initiate any credit transactions with the entities listed.

Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c requires that consumer reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of consumer information. The unauthorized disclosure of my information not only violates this statute but also exposes me to potential identity theft and other forms of financial harm. 

I request that you take the following actions : 1. **Conduct an immediate investigation** : As required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I request that you investigate these unauthorized entries on my credit report.

2. **Remove the disputed entries** : If the investigation finds these entries were indeed unauthorized, they must be promptly removed from my credit report.

3. **Provide written confirmation** : Send me a written confirmation that the unauthorized entries have been removed from my credit report.

4. **Send an updated credit report** : Provide me with a current copy of my credit report to verify the corrections.

Enclosed are copies of the relevant documents, including my recent credit report highlighting the disputed entries and any supporting documents that substantiate my claim.

Please consider this letter as a formal complaint and take all necessary actions to resolve this matter within the 30-day timeframe stipulated by the FCRA. Failure to do so may result in further legal action to protect my rights. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Acct Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ) it states this ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

( XXXX ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( XXXX ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agencyshall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. 

Delete this collection Account immediately because of violation of 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) & ( b ), 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ) & ( ii ), and 15 USC 1681e ( b ).

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call at my job stating I was going to be served on XX/XX/XXXX. I called the number left in the VM. I spoke with XXXX XXXX. She stated she was the Senior Paralegal for XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX at XXXXZoca Loans. She stated that on XX/XX/XXXX, I took an {$800.00} loan. She provided me with the email address of XXXX. I told her that was not my email and she said it did not matter. She gave me two four-digit numbers stating these were the last four of the routing number and account number, but was not sure which was which. She provided me with my full SSN, all assets attached to my SSN, my email address, my physical address and threatened to garnish my wages and seize my assets and put liens on my bank accounts. She stated they were going to start arbitration and litigation if i did not pay them {$6900.00} ( the amount i owed with interest ). I searched all my bank accounts and i did not have any deposits in my account from any of the companies stated in that amount on that date. I did have a loan on that date, but it was from a different company, with a different name and has been paid in full. I did have an account with XXXX, which was closed in XXXX with no balance or pending charges. I told her I have never pulled a loan from XXXX and have never heard of Zoca Loans. I requested they send me the letters they allegedly sent to me notifying me of this debt. She stated she could not. She stated that the actual reason for her call was to get my attorney information since I failed to respond to any of their communications. I told her this was the first I heard of this and needed some proof. She stated she could not send my anything, the call was being recorded and she would let XXXX XXXX listen to our conversation and make a decision on the next steps. After a brief hold, she came back on the line. She stated that she was not supposed to collect monies, but an exception would be made. She stated that XXXX XXXX agreed to two options for collection on this debt. I could pay XXXX payments of {$280.00}, making a good faith payment that day and the rest at my leisure or pay a settlement of {$1700.00} - three payments of {$590.00}, making a good faith payment that day. Unsure of what to do as I was not given the opportunity to make calls and call them back, I paid the settlement amount. I did not want to chance this being real and getting my non-profit seized, wages garnished and losing my car and bank accounts. She sent me a receipt for the transaction, gave me a confirmation code, and her direct phone number ( XXXX XXXX ). Immediately, I contacted XXXX and asked to speak to their loan department. The agent verified that my account was closed in XXXX and there were no loans taken out in my name or SSN. I gave him my full SSN to run through their system. I gave him the numbers she provided me as the last four of the routing and account numbers. He stated those were not numbers associated with the account I had with them. I provided him with all the phone numbers used in this interaction and he stated none of those numbers are associated with XXXX. After this verification, I contacted my credit card company and filed a fraudulent charge and froze all three of my credit reports. When the charge went through, there was a completely different company on the charge, XXXX XXXX XXXX. The receipt emailed to me had XXXX XXXX  on the letterhead with an address in NY. When I researched that address, it did not show this company in that location. I did not file a police report as I felt filing here would be sufficient. Please advise if I should file a report with my local police department.
