Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Deposits or withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/2023, I accidentally forced closed my CD account with Marcus Bank which held {$40000.00}.

After recognizing my mistake, I immediately opened up another CD account, herein after referred to as ( " account '' ) with Marcus Bank in order for the funds to be moved into same. 

Unfortunately, that was prohibited and I was advised that my funds were moved to Unclaimed Funds and I would be able to retrieve the money at a later date. I did close the unfunded account referenced above. 

Between XXXX and XXXX of 2023, I periodically checked the New Jersey Unclaimed Funds website anticipating the money to appear as a claim. The money never appeared on the website so I inquired with Marcus Bank to figure out where my monies were. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to a lower representative in the fraud department who advised me to call my bank from where the wire transfer initiated and report the wire transfer as fraud. As this was an incorrect advisement, I asked to be transferred to a supervisor. XXXX, a supervisor in the Fraud Department, advised that the account was closed and that she would initiate the account to be opened. At this point, no one would tell me where my monies were. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX, a supervisor in the Fraud Department who advised me that the money was being held in Marcus ' Unclaimed Funds Account and she would initiate the my CD account to be opened. Upon request, I was provided with a case number. It appears XXXX failed to complete her task. 

Please note between XXXX and XXXX, I kept checking online and my account remained frozen, unable to even access my profile. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX, a supervisor in the Fraud Department who advised that the prior representative ( XXXX XXXX did not do as she instructed and thus, he would initiate the reopening of the account in order for the funds to be transferred. He advised this should be done within a couple of days. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX, a supervisor in the Fraud Department who advised that she would expedite the reopening of the account in order for the funds to be transferred and to call on XX/XX/XXXX because this process usually took between 7-10 days. At this time, I instructed Marcus Bank to provide the funds in a check as the origination account was closed with XXXX XXXX XXXX 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX, a representative in the Fraud Department who advised the initiation of the reopening of the account was still in process. I was then transferred to XXXX XXXX same supervisor I spoke to on XX/XX/XXXX ) who said there was nothing to do at this time as the Review Department was still reviewing the alleged expedited request. I asked to be transferred to the Review Department and was advised that was prohibited. I asked to be transferred to someone higher than a supervisor and was told that was prohibited, they can all call you, you can not call them or be transferred. I asked XXXX to leave a note with a higher supervisor in addition with the Review Department to contact me. To date, I did not receive a call from the Review Department. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX who advised that the expedited link was expiring to reopen my account. XXXX provided me with a newer case number upon request as it seems the Supervisors in the Fraud Department tried to reopen the second CD account and not the first which was funded over a year ago. I put in a complaint with Marcus Bank and later that evening I received an email to call Marcus. I was advised the supervisor had left for the day by XXXX 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke to XXXX, an advanced supervisor whose demeanor left much to be desired. She advised that this matter was still being processed and there was nothing for her to do other than to wait and call back. 

After XXXX ( XXXX ) year, XXXX ( XXXX ) calls with various supervisors in the Fraud Department, one ( 1 ) complaint with the company, and two ( 2 ) requests to be contacted by the Review Department, this matter is still pending.

At this juncture, I enacted a Power of Attorney as this matter seems to be cumbersome with XXXX Bank and their determination to keep my monies from me. It appears that Marcus Bank and their Fraud Department provide frivolous comments only to pacify me with empty apologies and statements in which they can not make true on. I am beyond frustrated about this matter. I can not go to a branch due to the lack of one, can not speak to an advanced supervisor, can not be contacted or contact the Review Department and it seems Marcus Bank does not care. It feels as if they are holding my monies intentionally. It bears the question- is their fraudulent activity being conducted within their own Department? How can Marcus Bank, a FDIC branch of Goldman Sacks, not be able to resolve this matter after this many attempts over this period of time? 

I truly hope CFPB can help or I will be forced to speak to someone at a News Outlet in hopes they would be able to get the attention of Marcus Bank. 

Please note the monies were left to me by my late father and it was instructed that the monies to be used for higher education. I XXXX this XXXX and intended to use this money to achieve a XXXX XXXX, the first in my family, and to continue to make my father proud. To say I can not is profoundly sad.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your bureau and company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 6 letter and dispute I have sent to the creditors along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this credit bureau and credit companies are violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 6th notice to the bureau and the creditor companies notifying them that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected and this credit bureau or creditors are not honoring my identity theft claim. My 7th notice of litigation will be a lawsuit suing this credit bureau and all these creditors, these companies and credit bureau did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, Im going to sue for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from creditors, and assisting to furnish wrong and fraudulent accounts. I demand all accounts and inquiries be removed as soon as possible. 

Specifically, I refer to the following entries : 1. JPMCB Auto Finance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681b , consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, such as with the consumers written consent or in connection with a credit transaction initiated by the consumer. I did not provide my consent for the release or sharing of my personal information related to these accounts, nor did I initiate any credit transactions with the entities listed. 

Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c requires that consumer reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of consumer information. The unauthorized disclosure of my information not only violates this statute but also exposes me to potential identity theft and other forms of financial harm. 

I request that you take the following actions : 1. **Conduct an immediate investigation** : As required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I request that you investigate these unauthorized entries on my credit report. 
XXXX. **Remove the disputed entries** : If the investigation finds these entries were indeed unauthorized, they must be promptly removed from my credit report. 
XXXX. **Provide written confirmation** : Send me a written confirmation that the unauthorized entries have been removed from my credit report. 
XXXX. **Send an updated credit report** : Provide me with a current copy of my credit report to verify the corrections. 

Enclosed are copies of the relevant documents, including my recent credit report highlighting the disputed entries and any supporting documents that substantiate my claim. 

Please consider this letter as a formal complaint and take all necessary actions to resolve this matter within the 30-day timeframe stipulated by the FCRA. Failure to do so may result in further legal action to protect my rights. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Customer number XXXX Case number XXXX LEXISNEXIS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : REQUEST LETTER TO REMOVE INACCURATE INFORMATION To Whom It May Concern, Please accept this formal letter as my first request to investigate and remove derogatory accounts/items from my consumer report. Going over my report, I have found it has errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a consumer reporting agency 15 U.S.C. $ 1681a ( f ), you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 'FCRA '' ). 15 U.S.C. 1681, et seq., which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their consumer file. The FCRA states that it's the consumer reporting agency 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer files is accurate and free from errors. Your company is regularly engaged in the business of assembling, evaluating, and disbursing information concerning consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports, as defined in 15 U.S.C. {$1600.00} ( d ), to third parties. 
According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : 1 ) follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This section imposes a high and often disregarded standard on consumer reporting agencies. See, e.g., XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ) ( breaking down the requirements of 1681e ( b ), and explaining that " assure ' means 'to make sure or certain : put beyond all doubt, '' ' [ maximum ' means the 'greatest in quantity or highest degree attainable [, ] ' and 'possible ' means something falling within the bounds of what may be done, occur or be conceived. '' ( quoting XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXy 133, 1396, 1771 ( 1993 ) ) ; 2 ) comply with the investigation requirements, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ; 3 ) should not provide consumer files to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer files pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681g ; 5 ) et seq. 

Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer report. For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my consumer report. See. Exhibit A. 
Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the accounts/items 1 am disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary. 
I know that your company will need some sort of verification to prove my identity. My information is clearly shown below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX AZ XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent this letter via certified mail to ensure this matter is resolved within the required thirty ( 30 ) day window so as to avoid any violation of the FCRA. Finally, please send me a copy of the changed consumer report at the earliest. 
Thank you for your assistance in this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX, XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Re : Dispute of Debt and Revocation of Communication Rights I am writing to inform you that I dispute owning any and all debts to your company. I deny any liability for the alleged debt and request that you provide debt validation to support your claim. 

Furthermore, I revoke all rights of your communication with me through emails, text messages, or phone calls. I demand that you cease and desist all communication with me immediately. 

I request that you provide the following documentation : - A detailed accounting of the alleged debt, including the amount and origin of the debt - A copy of the original contract or agreement between me and the original creditor - A copy of the purchase agreement between your company and the original creditor - Proof of your company 's licensing and bonding I believe that your company has violated several laws, including : - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) : Failure to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of the debt - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) : Failure to provide accurate and complete information about the debt - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) : Failure to provide proper validation of the debt - 15 USC 1681-S ( 2 ) ( 7 ) ( a ) : Failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act 's requirements for debt collectoXXXX I demand that you provide the requested documentation and proof within 30 days. If I do not receive this information, I will assume that the debt is invalid and take further action to protect my rights. 

Please confirm in writing that you have received this letter and will comply with my requests. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Midland Credit Management , Inc. 
The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I am writing to dispute the collection account referenced above, which appears on my credit report. I am a victim of identity theft, and this account is not mine. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and request its removal if it can not be verified. The account in question was opened fraudulently using my personal information without my knowledge or consent. 

Upon contacting the collection agency to dispute this account, I was informed that they have the incorrect name associated with the account. Despite this acknowledgment, the collection account continues to appear on my credit report, causing significant harm to my creditworthiness. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information on my credit report and have it corrected or removed if it can not be verified. The collection agency 's failure to correct this error and the continued presence of this incorrect information on my credit report is a clear violation of my rights under the FCRA. 


The details of the disputed account are as follows : Creditor Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Collection Amount : {$620.00} Date of First Delinquency : XX/XX/XXXX Date of Collection Report : XX/XX/XXXX I request that you : 1. Conduct an investigation into this matter. 
XXXX. Remove this fraudulent collection account from my credit report immediately. 
XXXX. Cease all collection activities related to this account. 
XXXX. Provide written confirmation that the account has been removed from my credit report. 

I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies comply with their obligations under the FCRA. This inaccurate information must be removed from my credit report promptly. 
Please investigate this matter and instruct the collection agency and the credit reporting agencies to remove the incorrectly associated collection account from my credit report. I request a written confirmation once the investigation is complete and the account has been removed. 

Thank you for your assistance in resolving this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Dispute Letter to CFPB Regarding Jefferson Capital XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa XXXX XXXX : Dispute of Debt Collection Attempt by Jefferson Capital LLC Dear CFPB, This letter serves as a formal complaint against Jefferson Capital LLC regarding their attempt to collect a debt I allegedly owe. I am disputing all debts they are trying to collect from me. 
Dispute of Debt I am disputing any and all claims that I owe a debt to Jefferson Capital LLC. I request debt validation as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) Section 809 ( b ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This includes a clear breakdown of the debt, the original creditor, and the date the debt was allegedly incurred. 
Documentation Request To further investigate this matter, I request the following documentation from Jefferson Capital LLC : A copy of the original purchase agreement between myself and the original creditor. 
Proof that Jefferson Capital LLC is a bonded and licensed debt collector in my state. 
Communication Revocation I am revoking all consent for Jefferson Capital LLC to communicate with me via phone calls, text messages, or emails except to confirm receipt of this letter and to validate the debt, as required by the FDCPA. All future communication must be done in writing and sent to the address listed above. 
Potential Violations It has come to my attention that Jefferson Capital LLC may have violated the FDCPA in the following ways : Failing to provide debt validation information within the required timeframe XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Placing a collection on my credit report without giving me the opportunity to dispute it ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). 
Engaging in false, misleading, or deceptive practices. 
Furnishing inaccurate information to credit reporting agencies. 
I believe Jefferson Capital LLC 's actions violate the FDCPA Sections 807 ( b ), 809 ( a ) ( 4 ), and 806 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Request for Investigation I urge the CFPB to investigate these potential violations by Jefferson Capital LLC and take appropriate action to ensure they comply with the FDCPA. I request that you contact me with any updates or require further information from me. 
Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX, Louisiana XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an open account with Nordstrom since 2017. Unfortunately, there were some times that I fell behind due to a financial setback when I was in college that resulted in late payments. Despite this challenge, I diligently managed to catch up. However, I have discovered that this account is currently reflecting as negative account activity on my credit report.

This misleading information is impeding my ability to pursue a significant milestone in my life- buying a home. Maintaining good credit is of utmost importance to me, and I am eager to rectify this situation. I firmly believe in taking responsibility for my financial obligations and view good credit as non-negotiable. Now, I am compelled to request Nordstrom to remove the damaging information from my reports. I am aware of the importance of adhering to policies, but I also firmly believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to make amends for past mistakes. I firmly believe that the repercussions of unforeseen circumstances should not have a perpetual impact on one 's financial standing. People do deserve a goodwill or second chance. This is unfair that this information has to linger for years.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I checked into the campfire hotel in XXXX Oregon. I was charged {$490.00} which included two nights stay as well as {$100.00} deposit for incidentals. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, unbeknownst to me at the time, a charge appeared on my card from XXXX XXXX  for {$900.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I checked out of the hotel at approximately XXXX XXXX Upon returning home, I checked my account only to find out that the {$490.00} charge was not on the transaction history of my account but instead the {$900.00} charge as well as an additional charge for {$120.00} and one for {$410.00} both charged on the XXXX of XXXX. The {$410.00} was eventually taken off and refunded. 

While in the room there were three snack items that the {$100.00} deposit I initially left with them should have covered and I accidentally took a towel. Once finding out about the excessive charges of {$900.00}, {$120.00} and the {$410.00} charge I contacted the hotel which initially refused to give me a receipt for my stay. They told me that the sheets were dirty and there were cigarette butts on the floor. I left that room exceptionally clean and I'm extremely offended by their fabricated claims. They refuse to refund me the money they erroneously took out of my account while I was staying there. If they're so sure I caused damage to the room then why did they charge me before I even checked out? I am XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX which was obvious during check-in and I am on a limited income through SSA every month. They have severely cause me damage to my ability to take care of myself for the remainder of the month.

Consumer complaint narrative: I recently filed a complaint about portfolio recovery attempting to collect a debt without properly giving me notification for the following account XXXX. I requested that they provide me with evidence that they gave me proper notice allowing me to dispute the debt before it reached my consumer report however they did not provide that document. I also requested the purchase agreement since they claimed that they purchased the debt but they also failed to provide that ( complaint # XXXX ). Now I am certain that they are attempting to collect a debt that is not owed and are falsely reporting an account on my consumer report without having any proper verification. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1692g ( c ) Failure to dispute the validity of a debt can not be construed as admission ( I never received proper notification nor have they provided proof I received notification ). This is a huge violation of the consumer protection act and this is going to be their last chance to rectify this situation by deleting this account from my consumer reports before I seek further action. If Portfolio recovery believes otherwise, then I demand that they provide the certified green return card bearing my signature at least 30 days prior to reporting this information AND the purchase agreement.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Charged too much interest
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Urgent : Discrepancy in Interest Charges Date : XX/XX/year> Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to you concerning a recent issue with my Capital One account. I was charged {$16.00} in interest, which was bewildering since I always pay the last statement balance to avoid any interest. I have done this for over XXXX years. After advocating for myself, Capital One refunded me the interest charge of {$16.00} on XX/XX/year>. They reported it will take XXXX business days to show up on my account. 

The reason for this letter is to illustrate XXXX problems. 

I paid off my last statement balance of {$1000.00}, but somehow it changed after the cycle date to {$1100.00}. This is the first problem. The second problem is that the {$16.00} was calculated from a fictitious balance of {$700.00} and not {$90.00} ( the difference between what I paid and the mysterious new payoff of {$1100.00} ). Using their own calculation XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX per month or XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX My actual published XXXX from Capital One is XXXX XXXX 

They literally calculated interest off a fictitious balance and changed my last statement balance to charge me {$16.00}. 

This is clearly unethical, if not illegal, under current XXXX regulations. 

Please correct this for the average consumer. There could be millions of consumers being swindled right now.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: I have late payments on this account that were never late and was never given notification Ive been in contact with this company on a multitude of occasions, even referring to the law and they have failed to respond I demand these late payments removed. Ive requested multiple occasions verification of these alleged late payments and the company seems to not care about their customers. I demand late payments removed as Ive already been through financial and emotional turmoil due to these payments effecting my credit scores. I demand late payments removed/updated. 15 U.S Code 1666b. A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Furthermore, In accordance with The Fair Credit Reporting Act, Public law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsection A-D, I demand that you provide actual proof the information was verified, not a computer generated confirmation 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Debt or credit management
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been working with Beyond Finance since late XXXX. Four credit cards and two student loans were enrolled, and two of the credit cards have been completely settled. One credit card was scheduled to be settled this month ( XX/XX/XXXX ), and the other in XXXX, with the two loans to be settled in XX/XX/XXXX. Until last month, everything had gone according to schedule, though I was always mystified at the lack of communication on some important elements. 

In early XXXX, a large credit was issued to my account -- possibly because they were not able to negotiate a very favorable deal with the student loan people, and I had said that I thought they should give me a break on the settlement fee. Or not -- it was never explained, it just appeared. Several months ago, amounts were withdrawn from my account -- possibly because it was decided that the original credit was an error. Or not -- it also was never explained. 

This meant that the amount that I was paying into the account would be less than the amount needed by them to make payments to the creditors. Again -- this was not communicated to me, I worked it out for myself. Since then, I have called the company each month and the agent and I figured out ( with much difficulty! ) how much extra that I should deposit to cover the shortfall. So far, so good. 

In XXXX -- I believe it was the XXXX -- they sent a very puzzling ( to me ) communication about a settlement (? ) which I assumed to be an error, but I did call and spoke to an agent ; I believe it was on XX/XX/XXXX. She couldn't see any reason for my having received that message, but we worked out how much money needed to be deposited for XXXX, and I arranged to put in an extra {$250.00}. 

A week or so ago when I logged on to the Beyond website, there was a lot of confusing information about settlements that were in progress, and nothing available about the previous and future payments I was making on the remaining 4 accounts. Several calls to Beyond resulted in even more confusion, until the other day, the agent informed me that because there had not been enough funds in the account to cover one of the credit card payments, and because I had not responded within 15 days (!! I did!! ), that account had reverted to delinquency. For reasons that were not explained ( are we seeing a pattern here? ), two other accounts that were paid on time through XXXX also went back into " Settlement negotiation ''. One account was not affected and seems to be continuing on its way to settlement ... at least for the moment. 

I was finally able to log on to the website that is used to track the actual payments ( the " Dedicated Account '' page on Beyond 's website does not give any details on... much ), and discovered that in XXXX, Beyond had assessed another " Settlement Fee '' which not only did I not know about, but apparently the agent that told me to deposit {$250.00} didn't know about either. That Settlement Fee was the reason that there were not enough funds to pay the one creditor. At no time was I ever contacted and asked for a specific amount that would have covered it -- if I had, I would have paid it! 

So now they seem ( I say " seem '' because, again, no communication ) to be re-negotiating settlement agreements on 3 accounts, which look like they will come in at a higher level than what I have been paying. Also, I'm guessing that they will assess a " Settlement Fee '' for each of the three accounts -- the one that was delinquent through no fault of mine, and the two that were not delinquent at all. Meanwhile it also seems that this whole situation is playing havoc with my credit rating. All this after almost 3 years of on-time payments, and good faith, proactive efforts to be sure the account remained in good standing. The whole situation seems like a nightmare ; I only wish it was.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative: Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to file a formal complaint against the three major credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ). For their failure to address and correct fraudulent activities on my credit report, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I discovered unauthorized accounts on my credit reports from all three reporting agencies. Specifically the fraudulent accounts include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Upon realizing this, I contacted the CRAs and provided them with necessary documentation to prove that these accounts were a result of identity theft, including a police report and FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. 1. Failure to Block Fraudulent Information ( 15 U.S.C. s 1681c-2 ) Under the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C s 1681c-2, credit reporting agencies are required to block the reporting of information that resulted from identity theft within four business days of receipt of appropriate documentation, the CRAs have failed to block the fraudulent information on my credit reports. 2. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation ( 15 U.S.C s 1681i ( a ) : The FCRA mandates that CRAs conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information. I have repeatedly disputed the fraudulent accounts with the CRAs, yet they continue to verify the fraudulent information without proper investigation, in violation of 15 U.S.C s 1681i ( a )

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear IQ Data International, Re : Dispute of Debt and Revocation of Communication Rights I am writing to inform you that I dispute owning any and all debts to your company. I deny any liability for the alleged debt and request that you provide debt validation to support your claim. 

Furthermore, I revoke all rights of your communication with me through emails, text messages, or phone calls. I demand that you cease and desist all communication with me immediately. 

I request that you provide the following documentation : - A detailed accounting of the alleged debt, including the amount and origin of the debt - A copy of the original contract or agreement between me and the original creditor - A copy of the purchase agreement between your company and the original creditor - Proof of your company 's licensing and bonding I believe that your company has violated several laws, including : - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) : Failure to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of the debt - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) : Failure to provide accurate and complete information about the debt - 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) : Failure to provide proper validation of the debt - 15 USC 1681-S ( 2 ) ( 7 ) ( a ) : Failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act 's requirements for debt collectors I demand that you provide the requested documentation and proof within 30 days. If I do not receive this information, I will assume that the debt is invalid and take further action to protect my rights. 

Please confirm in writing that you have received this letter and will comply with my requests. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, XXXX

I filed a cryber crime report in connection with the matter and disputed the unauthorized transactions with chime. 

They denied my disputes, I have re-opened the dispute going on the third time now and they still will not budge. The charges were unauthorized. PERIOD. 

As a visa card issuer, chime is bound by the visa card issuer agreement with regards to unauthorized transactions and must also conform to regulation XXXX. 

In addition chime has what is called a XXXX XXXX XXXX and what this means is that account holders who report unauthorized charges within a certain time frame shall not be held liable for the unautorized charges. 

Chime seems to believe no error has occured when obviously due to the number of transactions, how close apart they take place, and the ammounts in question this is obviously fraud that has taken place. 

I will contact the media and escalate to legal action if chime does not reimburse me for the unauthorized charges in question.

Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative:
I tried using my unopened {$100.00} gift card for the first time in XX/XX/XXXX and was surprised to find out my gift card had less than {$3.00}. I looked up the gift card balance online and realized there was fraud with my gift card. Multiple people stole my card information in XX/XX/XXXX and were able to use my gift card in multiple states on the same day when my card was at home, safe in my room, and I was out of the country on vacation. There was no way I or anyone I know was using my gift card for those transactions. It was involved in a gift card scam! I contacted Vanilla gift cards and told them everything. Submitted a form that took months for them to review because they had an error in the dispute form that I had to repeated email and call them to fix. After FINALLY fixing my dispute form and submitting it, I received an email months later that they DENIED my dispute. They refused to put the STOLEN funds back on my Vanilla Visa Gift Card. Their response : " Dear Cardholder, This letter is to inform you that we have completed our investigation regarding the referenced ticket above.

We take concerns from cardholders very seriously. After a thorough review of your account and evaluation of the evidence provided, we regret to inform you that we are unable to approve your dispute. With the denial of this dispute, your case has been closed.

Per the cardholder agreement and the payments network, these transactions are out of timeframe for recovery. '' A bogus excuse. These transactions would be impossible by me alone which would be easy to discover doing some simple research. " Out of the timeframe for recovery '' should go out the window when it's clear to see by the date, times, and locations these transactions happened. Gift card expiration date is XX/XX/XXXX. 

Listed below are the transactions that were not mine that my unopened gift cards was used for : Merchant Name : XXXX # XXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$1.00} Merchant Name : XXXX  Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$5.00} Merchant Name : XXXX XXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX  Transaction Amount : {$.00} Merchant Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$83.00} Merchant Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$100.00} Merchant Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$.00} Merchant Name : XXXX XXXX Transaction Date : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX EST Transaction Amount : {$14.00}

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company must remove and all collections against my credit reports immediately. My dispute is based upon the Federal Trade Commission guidelines pertaining to either debt collections as a third-party, or debt buyers in general. The rules are as follows : 1. A debt collector/buyer must be bonded and licensed by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
2. The debt must be legally collectible within the states jurisdiction where the creditor resides.

3. Creditor must be given copies of debt collector/buyer license, bonding number with insurance carrier name and address, a copy of any assignment to collect on original creditors behalf, and/or copies on ant ownership transfer with true copy certification. 
4. A debt purchase must have an assignment number and be registered with the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. 
5. Any debt not within these guidelines must be deleted from a consumers credit report with prejudice.

6. This company has posted one or more out dated collection against my credit report. It looks like the account was over 10 years old, and the information was acquired through a debt pooling service. The collections must be deleted permanently!!!

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear Sir/Madam, Subject : Request for Debt Validation and Removal from Credit Report Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding SUNRISE CREDIT SERVICE located at XXXX Corporate XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Several months ago, I requested a XXXX XXXX XXXX from this organization as per my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). However, to date, I have not received any response or the requested validation of the alleged debt. 

In the absence of a XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am unable to verify the legitimacy of this debt. This failure to respond constitutes a violation of the FDCPA, which mandates that a debt collector must provide validation of a debt upon request. 

Given this lack of response, I am formally requesting that this alleged debt be removed from all credit bureaus immediately. The failure of SUNRISE CREDIT SERVICE to provide the requested validation leaves me with no other recourse but to seek your assistance in ensuring that this erroneous debt is expunged from my credit records. 

I trust that the CFPB will take the necessary steps to address this issue promptly. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift response and resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Trafficking Block Request To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to advise that I am a victim of trafficking. For your convenience and reference, I have attached supporting documents that substantiate my claim. The information listed below, that is currently listed on my credit report is a result of that trafficking Please block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. This section provides the right to request the deletion of information from a credit report as a result of trafficking.

Per 605C - 2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer. 
The Bureau is adopting several amendments to Regulation V to implement new section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ,1 added by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 ( 2022 NDAA ) .2 In brief, section 605C provides that a consumer reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing any adverse item of information concerning a consumer that resulted from a severe form of trafficking in persons or sex trafficking if the consumer has provided trafficking documentation to the consumer reporting agency.3 Under section 605C, the Bureau is required to issue implementing regulations within 180 days of the enactment of the XXXX NDAA . Section 605C is effective 30 days after the Bureau issues its final implementing regulations. 
BILLING CODE : XXXXXXXX BUREAU OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION 12 CFR Part 1022 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Prohibition on Inclusion of Adverse Information in Consumer Reporting in Cases of Human Trafficking ( Regulation V ) Please send me notification of the actions taken. I greatly appreciate your prompt expedited action to this matter.

1. I applied for a mortgage loan online with Rocket Mortgage around XX/XX/XXXX. 
2. I submitted all income, assets and expenses requested and completed my XXXX & XXXX as instructed and submitted proof of funds to close. ( List of Documents submitted available ). 
3. I paid the honest money to the title company ( twice ) due to the sellers willing to accept a XXXX purchase order after continued efforts by Rocket Mortgage to stall the loan and changing the closing date repeatedly per issuance of a " Conditional Closing Dates ''.

4. Continued hits on my credit to drive my score down.

5. Continued inclusion of team members handling my file and information, bringing only more requests and no solutions.

6. The latest request of obtaining a co-signer for this purchase is out of character.

7. I do not want to continue this process with them, I simply want a refund of my {$500.00} paid to for the appraisal of which I can't use and the {$2000.00} honest money paid to the sellers ( if they are not willing to refund my honest money ) due to the exhausting delays by Rocket Mortgage. 8. Also, I want refunded to me the interest cost of having funds transferred from my XXXX account to my checking in preparation of the promised closing date ( available funds to collect by XXXX ). 
8. Today, I'm sending a email reply to XXXX to cancel the application due to my belief that they have no intentions of approving this loan ( unsubstantiated ). 
9. This have been a very exhausting, wasteful, expensive, time consuming, harassing process which leaves a " XXXX XXXX '' on me and for Rocket Mortgage.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company must remove and all collections against my credit reports immediately. My dispute is based upon the Federal Trade Commission guidelines pertaining to either debt collections as a third-party, or debt buyers in general. The rules are as follows : 1. A debt collector/buyer must be bonded and licensed by the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX 
2. The debt must be legally collectible within the states jurisdiction where the creditor resides.

3. Creditor must be given copies of debt collector/buyer license, bonding number with insurance carrier name and address, a copy of any assignment to collect on original creditors behalf, and/or copies on ant ownership transfer with true copy certification. 
4. A debt purchase must have an assignment number and be registered with the XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX. 
5. Any debt not within these guidelines must be deleted from a consumers credit report with prejudice.

6. This company has posted one or more out dated collection against my credit report. It looks like the account was over XXXX XXXX XXXX, and the information was acquired through a debt pooling service. The collections must be deleted permanently!!!

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with the payoff process at the end of the loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I owed {$270.00} on a loan from Oportun. They sent me an email offer stating that if I paid {$98.00}, the loan would be settled and I would not owe anything else. The email explicitly stated : After paying the settlement amount as agreed, you will no longer owe a balance and your account will be reported as CHARGED OFFPAID to the credit bureaus. 

I called the number provided to accept the offer on XX/XX/2024 and made the {$98.00} payment during the same phone call. The man I spoke with told me it would be settled as promised once the payment was processed. The payment was processed and accepted on XX/XX/XXXX. However, Oportun still says I owe the remainder of the loan. Instead of settling my loan as promised, they are still claiming I must pay the rest, and continue to harass me with repeated phone calls. I have attempted multiple times to resolve this, by email and phone, and am getting nowhere. First they said I had to wait XXXX days to make sure the payment processed ( even though I could see it already had ). Now they are saying 30 days and continuing to call me asking for the rest of the balance.

I have never ever heard of Wisely before and I didn't apply or enroll for a card with them or create an account with them given that I have never heard of them before. Today, on XX/XX/year> I received the card with all the papers on how to activate it. I tried calling their customer support number that was on their website as well as on the back of the card. When calling, I was answered by an automated message system where I was asked to put in the card number as well as some other information such as the last 4 digits of my social security number and the year I was born. After doing that, I was just prompted to activate the card which I don't want to do. I was never able to actually speak with a real person from their company or customer support. I am also the only person within my household to be sent this email or card. My main concern/ question is how & why I was sent this card from a company I have never heard of and never signed up/ enrolled in? And how they got my information to send it to me to begin with? I'm aware this company has my name, email, home address, city & zip code, although I don't know what other personal information of mine they may have.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, LVNV Funding LLC sued me on a time-barred debt in a jurisdictional district where I did not reside. The company knew, or should have known, that fact. Not only did LVNV Funding LLC sued, but they made a false declaration to the Court that I was properly served process in person at an address that I did not reside on the date I was allegedly served. Furthermore, despite several request for verification and/or validation of the alleged debt, LVNV Funding is yet to provide such verification and/or validation. 

Summary : ( 1 ) On XX/XX/year>, defendant violated s.1006.26 of the FDCPA by filing a lawsuit on a time-barred debt.

( 2 ) Contrary to s.811of the FDCPA, defendant unequivocally filed a lawsuit in XXXX XXXX XXXX TN, a jurisdictional district in which plaintiff did not reside at the commencement of the action on XX/XX/year> or anytime thereafter. 
( XXXX ) Furthermore, defendant failed to verify and/or validate the alleged debt within 30 days of initial contact ; thus violating s. 809 of the aforementioned statute.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative: I recently filed a complaint about LVNV FUNDING attempting to collect a debt without properly giving me notification for the following account XXXX. I requested that they provide me with evidence that they gave me proper notice allowing me to dispute the debt before it reached my consumer report however they did not provide that document. I also requested the purchase agreement since they claimed that they purchased the debt but they also failed to provide that ( complaint # XXXX ). A different company ( Resurgent Capital Services ) than the onXXXX on my consumer report responded to my dispute which violates the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Now I am certain that they are attempting to collect a debt that is not owed and are falsely reporting an account on my consumer report without having any proper verification. XXXX has actually deleted this account from my consumer report which further proves the validity of my claim ( see attached ). Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1692g ( c ) Failure to dispute the validity of a debt can not be construed as admission ( I never received proper notification nor have they provided proof I received notification ). This is a huge violation of the consumer protection act and this is going to be their last chance to rectify this situation by deleting this account from my consumer reports before I seek further action. If LVNV FUNDING believes otherwise, then I demand that they provide the certified green return card bearing my signature at least 30 days prior to reporting this information AND the purchase agreement.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX From, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Email : XXXX Phone : XXXX To, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, CFPB Complaint Against : CMG Financial, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ XXXX Mortgage Loan # XXXX Description of the Issue : Inappropriate Credit Reporting that Ruined our Loan capability Due to auto-pay mishap, we ( husband and wife ) were reported 1X30 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ), and 1X 60 days late ( XX/XX/XXXX ) mortgage payment to credit bureaus by one of the 5 mortgage lenders namely CMG. This ruined our new purchase loan/refinance loan capability. We have 2 adjustable-rate mortgage loans and one of which adjusted this month to 8 % interest rate and we need to refinance this loan urgently. Both my husband and I currently have 5 mortgage loans and one auto ( XXXX ) loan on-going as our obligations and we have never ever been late for any of the other loans. We had several mortgage loans in the past that were paid-off/refinanced and none of them has ever been late ( See Attachment 3, pages 21-138 ). We also have several credits cards and none of them has any late payments ( See Attachment 3, pages 21-138 ). 

I am attaching my husband XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  statements covering the period XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX, of the account that is used to make the mortgage payments to CMG ( Attachment 3, pages 9-20 ). You can see the payments went through for XXXX and XXXX and did not go through during XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX due to Autopay mishap. 

All XXXX missed payments + on-time XXXX payment were paid together on XX/XX/XXXX ( approx. $ XXXX ). You can see the balance in the account was ~ $ XXXX by the end of XXXX and increased to ~ $ XXXX by the end of XXXX. The account piled up on money from the direct deposit of his employment paychecks when the payments were not going through. His account balance is a proof that he doesnt have to stop the payment due to any financial burden. At that time, we both had a combined reserve of approx. $ XXXX ( See Attachment 3, pages 139-171 ). 

My husband did not cancel the Autopay. After the 3rd party credit monitoring agency alerted me of my lower credit score, it was when I alerted my husband and we reviewed everything and realized the missed payments. Immediately we swung into action and paid-up all missed payments altogether on XX/XX/XXXX ( approx. $ XXXX ). My husband was not well during the missed payments ' time and so he wasn't checking his bank account. Else, he would have noticed the money piling up and investigated. 

My husband immediately called CMG who promised to remove the late reporting from credit file and also promised to remove the late fees. They removed 1 late fee, but did not remove the other late fees. After that we did not hear anything from CMG. We then initiated email dispute with CMG ( Attachment 1 and 3 ). CMG suggested that we initiate dispute directly from credit bureaus and also submit a letter to CMG with our wet signature ( See Attachment 1, page 9 ). We complied to both. But CMG denied fixing the late reporting in response to both. 

Why did CMG give false promise on the phone? Why did CMG ask us to go in the laborious routes of dispute with credit bureaus and letter with wet signature if they knew they will eventually deny it? Attachment 1 has written proof of CMG asking us to submit letter with wet signature and to submit dispute with credit bureaus. We then filed complaint with XXXX  but CMG maintained its denial position ( See Attachment 2 ). 

CMG never got in touch with my husband or me ( both of us are on the loan ) to alert us on the missed payments. Our address changed, and lender 's portal doesn't display our contact details and doesn't have an option to add/update our contact details. If the mortgage portal doesnt have an option to update contact details, how are we to inform CMG of our address/phone change? If lender couldn't get in touch with my husband, they should have contacted me ( I am co-borrower ) as plan B. But they never contacted me. How is it fair that my credit is ruined without me knowing none of these events? Lender should be reaching out to borrowers when a payment is missed and not wait indefinitely and report to credit bureaus. This happened because the mortgage portal doesnt have option to update contact details. A low budget lender with low budget systems failed us? How is it fair? I request CFPB to intervene and help us by instructing CMG to remove the late payment reporting from our credit files. 


Thank you very much. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Attachments : Attachment 1 : XXXX Dispute with CMG through XXXX Email disputes directly with CMG from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX Our letter with wet signature to CMG per the request of CMG XX/XX/XXXX Attachment XXXX : XXXX Complaint and XXXX XXXX  complaint filed on XX/XX/XXXX CMGs denial response on XX/XX/XXXX, My rejection response to CMGs denial on XX/XX/XXXX CMGs continued denial on XX/XX/XXXX, My continued rejection on XX/XX/XXXX Attachment XXXX : XXXX Dispute with CMG through XXXX Continued Email disputes directly with CMG from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX  statements for XXXX XXXX showing piled-up money during missed payment period, provided to CMG on XX/XX/XXXX Our combined reserves of $ XXXX showing proof of no financial difficulty, provided to CMG on XX/XX/XXXX Copies of our credit reports showing the only negatives in our credit file ( out of 5 mortgage loans, 1 auto-loan, 20+ credit cards ) are the 2 late-payments reported by CMG

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am allowed under the HIPAA law ( Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of XXXX  ) to protect my privacy and medical records from third parties. I do not recall giving permission to ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) for them to release my medical information to a third party. I am aware that the HIP AA does allow for limited information about me, but anything more is to only be revealed with the patient 's authorization, therefore my request is twofold and as follows : Validation of Debt and HIPAA authorization Please provide a breakdown of fees including all collection costs and medical charges Please provide a copy of my signature with the provider of service to release my medical information to you Immediately cease any credit bureau reporting until debt has been validated by me Please respond by sending this information and accept this notice as my formal debt validation request, which I am allowed under the FDCPA. 
Please note that withholding the information you received from any medical provider in an attempt to be HIPAA compliant can be a violation of the FDCPA because you will be deceiving me after my written request. I am requesting full documentation of what you received from the provider of service in connection with this alleged debt. 
Furthermore, any reporting of this debt to the credit bureaus prior to allowing me to validate it may be a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which can allow me to seek damages from a collection agent. 
I await your reply with the above requested proof.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
Request For Debt Validation Pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Be Advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 USC 1692g ] stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request LVNV FUNDING provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay LVNV FUNDING a balance of {$1700.00}.

At this time, I will also inform LVNV FUNDING that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by LVNV FUNDING or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character ( per se ).

If LVNV FUNDING are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 calendar days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and DESIST.

Also, during this validation period, LVNV FUNDING must provide the proper documentation in regards to the following 4 questions below : 1 ) SEND ME A DETAILED LIST OF ALL THE HISTORY OF PAYMENTS MADE BY ME ON THIS ACCOUNT # XXXX. 

2 ) I WANT TO SEE THE SIGNATURE THAT I PUT ON A CONTRACT GUARANTEEING I WOULD PAY LVNV FUNDING LLC.

3 ) I WOULD LIKE TO SEE ANY INSURANCE CLAIMS FILED ON THIS DEBT.

4 ) I WANT PROOF THAT LVNV FUNDING LLC HAS THE CHAIN OF TITLE TO COLLECT ON THIS DEBT. 

Without any of the following questions being answered and without proper documentation from LVNV FUNDING. The consumer will not have been afforded his right to due process.

Cherry Servicing doesn't immediately send you the loan details, so I didn't get that information until XX/XX/year>, when they said my payment was coming up. I've since researched Cherry Servicing LLC and found that they often engage bait and switch interest loans. Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Unexpected increase in interest rate
Consumer complaint narrative:
Concora Credit, which recently acquired XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX recently sent me XXXX letters, XXXX for each of my respective cards. Both letters are relatively the same in its verbiage, but in differing amounts. These letters notified that not only is Concora going to increase the interest rates of XXXX of my cards to XXXX XXXX  but both of my cards are now subject to monthly maintenance fees. The Indigo card will be reviving a fee of XXXX  XXXX, whereas the XXXX XXXX  will be receiving a fee of $ XXXX. These letters also state that I have the right to reject these changes. However, it also states that should I choose to do so, my account will subsequently be closed, and Ill need to pay the account in full. It should be noted that these cards already had hefty annual fees in place upon signing up for them. 
The second provision states that by choosing to continue keeping these accounts active, I am subject to these changes no matter what occurs with my account, including transferring the balance and closing it. Along with this, by essentially taking no action, I wont be able to participate in a class action lawsuit, nor have any legal bearing to file an individual claim against Concora under any circumstance, including the validity of these changes, and breach of contract. 
This is predatory in nature. This company knows that the vast majority of its card holders have a lower credit score, and probably dont have the means to file a lawsuit if they wanted to. Furthermore, if this isnt a textbook example of breach of contract, Im not sure what is. I am an existing customer who agreed to certain and specific terms upon application. To change these terms with no recourse other than to cause immediate damage to my credit score is far from ethical and surely can not be legal.

On XX/XX/XXXX, the company responded in its via XXXX XXXX XXXX with the message below : Hello, We are reaching out for the information you are requesting. This will be sent via this portal as soon as it is received. Thank you, XXXX XXXX XXXX Monday-Friday XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The information requested has not been provided to me as of XX/XX/XXXX. I do not believe that I owe this, and I dispute it. As a result, on XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed a physical letter with tracking to Launch servicing LLC at their mailing address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. In that letter, in accordance the XXXX Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, XXXX XXXX. XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX. Protecting Consumers from Unjust Debt Collection Practices Amendment Act of XXXX, I requested that Launch Servicing provide me, in writing, the following information : XXXX. The name of the original creditor, and the name of any other owners of your debt, including the current owner XXXX. The last account number with the original creditor ( if applicable ) XXXX. A copy of the signed contract, application, or other documents which show your obligations XXXX. The date your debt was incurred XXXX. The date of your last payment, if applicable XXXX. An itemized accounting of the alleged debt, including the amount of any principal interest, fees, or charges, and whether the charges were imposed by the original creditor, a debt collector, or other owner of the debt. 

Also, in that letter I requested that Launch Servicing please provide this letter to the company for whom you are collecting so that they have notice of my dispute. 

The XXXX arrived at Launch Servicing 's mailing address on XX/XX/XXXX. I still have not received a response or the requested information from Launch Servicing as of XX/XX/XXXX. 

Per XXXX XXXX XXXX. Protecting Consumers from Unjust Debt Collection Practices Amendment Act of XXXX, upon receipt of the first request by a consumer for any of the information identified in paragraph ( XXXX ) of this subsection, the debt collector shall send all of the information listed in paragraph ( XXXX ) of this subsection to the consumer in writing within XXXX days of the receipt of the request and shall cease all collection of the consumer debt until such information is provided. Launch Servicing is well beyond XXXX days of receipt of initial request as well as requests made after.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filling a complaint against Chase Bank in accordance with 15 USC 1666b because of inaccurate consumer reporting regarding late payments that are incorrect. I was never late and they needed to provide the disclosures stated under 1681 EI.

15 USC 1666b states : ( a ) Time to make payments : A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

Chase made an error in reporting that the account was 60-90 days past due and that is incorrect. The account balance is also incorrect.

Chase Bank never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding an issue with my auto loan that has persisted despite my attempts to resolve it with my lender. My auto loan account number is # XXXX, and it was with consumer portfolio services inc. 

In XX/XX/2023, my car was declared a total loss due to an auto theft. My insurance company, XXXX XXXX, paid off the remaining balance of the loan in full. I received confirmation from both my insurance company and the lender that the payment was processed and the loan was settled. 

However, despite the loan being paid off, I have continued to receive billing statements from consumer portfolio services, indicating that I still owe money on the account. I have contacted the lender multiple times to resolve this issue, but they have failed to correct the account status and stop the billing. 

This ongoing issue has caused me considerable stress and has adversely affected my credit score, as the lender has reported these supposed missed payments to the credit bureaus. I believe this is an unfair and deceptive practice and is causing me undue financial harm. 

I am requesting the CFPBs assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that consumer portfolio services, corrects the status of my account to reflect that the loan was paid off by the insurance company in XX/XX/2023. Additionally, I seek the removal of any negative information related to this account from my credit report.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I contacted Chime Finacial INC to file a dispute for the unauthorized and fraudulent use of my visa debit card. The XXXX charges totalling {$4200.00}. They were sent to a person that was in a treatment facility with no access to any devices that could make a transaction. During their time at the facility their account was hacked as well. I informed the chime agent of this when I filed the dispute. The next day, XX/XX/year>, chime sends me a email saying they found no error and my account would not credited. I immediately filed a Rebuttal. Today, XX/XX/year>, I called chimes dispute team around XXXX eastern time to request a email so I could upload a email from a merchant where my current chime debit card was used to make an unauthorized transaction by someone I do not know, never even heard of before. Around 12 hours later I check my account finding no credits has been issued even though they have had evidence proving my account was hacked. I called the dispute team around XXXX to ask if the email from the merchant with my card number and a stranger 's name was evidence that a error has occurred with my account, therefore only further proving that the XXXX charges were fraudulent just as I said. The dispute team Agent I just got off the phone with said the document I sent them at a little after XXXX today was proof a error has occurred with my account since the name on the account is not my name and my visa debit card issued by XXXX XXXX FDIC Insured was charged unauthorized. I asked the Agent since the Federal Law requires the financial institution to place the funds in a consumers account within one business day after a error has been proven & acknowledged by the financial institution if my account would be credited by XXXX tomorrow since that would be 24 hours after Chime got the evidence proving without a doubt that a recent charge was fraudulent. She informed that it was up to the investigation team and if any credits was going to be issued it would be by XX/XX/year>. She would make a note for the investigation team, that apparently has no phones or direct email for me to get in contact to actually see what is going on and why my account has not been credited already. I'm beyond infuriated with this situation. Chime Financial Inc Dispute Team Agent said YES a ERROR was made, yes my dispute was originally denied a few short hours after filing, YES the email I sent to them was evidence enough to show my account was used unauthorized, and then she said I DONT KNOW IF THE INVESTIGATION TEAM WILL CREDIT YOUR ACCOUNT! I KNOW MY RIGHTS AND CHIMES INVESTIGATION TEAM DOES NOT HAVE A CHOICE IN REGARDS TO PUTTING STOLEN FUNDS BACK INTO MY ACCOUNT. Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the unauthorized furnishing of my personal credit information by your bureau and company. According to my recent credit report, there are entries that I did not authorize and which I believe are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is the 6 letter and dispute I have sent to the creditors along with my police report, FTC report, and supporting identity documents verifying my identity. I indicated in all my letters and police report that I am indeed a victim of identity theft, and this credit bureau and credit companies are violating my consumer rights and not protecting me as an American consumer according to the stated laws. This is my 6th notice to the bureau and the creditor companies notifying them that these listed accounts are fraud. My information isnt protected and this credit bureau or creditors are not honoring my identity theft claim. My 7th notice of litigation will be a lawsuit suing this credit bureau and all these creditors, these companies and credit bureau did not honor my rights or acknowledge my supporting documents regarding identity theft. I was incarcerated for 10 years with proof when all these accounts were open illegally and fraudulently and Ive proven this matter and will prove it in court without a doubt, Im going to sue for my rights being violated, pain and suffering, false allegations from creditors, and assisting to furnish wrong and fraudulent accounts. I demand all accounts and inquiries be removed as soon as possible. 

Specifically, I refer to the following entries : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$37000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX {$53000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX {$500.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$1000.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXk {$2500.00} XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX {$530.00} XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX {$410.00} XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX {$970.00} XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681b , consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances, such as with the consumers written consent or in connection with a credit transaction initiated by the consumer. I did not provide my consent for the release or sharing of my personal information related to these accounts, nor did I initiate any credit transactions with the entities listed.

Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c requires that consumer reporting agencies ensure the accuracy and privacy of consumer information. The unauthorized disclosure of my information not only violates this statute but also exposes me to potential identity theft and other forms of financial harm.

I request that you take the following actions : 1. **Conduct an immediate investigation** : As required by 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I request that you investigate these unauthorized entries on my credit report.

2. **Remove the disputed entries** : If the investigation finds these entries were indeed unauthorized, they must be promptly removed from my credit report.

3. **Provide written confirmation** : Send me a written confirmation that the unauthorized entries have been removed from my credit report.

4. **Send an updated credit report** : Provide me with a current copy of my credit report to verify the corrections.

Enclosed are copies of the relevant documents, including my recent credit report highlighting the disputed entries and any supporting documents that substantiate my claim. 

Please consider this letter as a formal complaint and take all necessary actions to resolve this matter within the 30-day timeframe stipulated by the FCRA. Failure to do so may result in further legal action to protect my rights. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I advised her that XXXX, my student loan company, reports to all 3 credit bureaus monthly. She then said that I haven't had student loans on my credit report since XXXX ; which can not be true since I have 4 years of payments to finish. 

I called back the following Monday and was transferred to another department. The man I spoke with says there was nothing wrong with my report and wanted to transfer me back to member services. When I asked for someone above him to help make sense of this issue, he hung up on me. 

I have been denied credit line increases because when the company attempted to pull my Experian account, they were told there was no credit file available. 

Experian is deliberately interfering with my ability to conduct business and refuse to fix the issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Im writing to express my deep disappointment in Rushmore Loan Management, Rushmore Servicing and Mr. Cooper. Allow me to explain...

When my loan was held by Rushmore Loan Management, I was asked to provide a copy of the XXXX policy ( see attachments ). I provided evidence of this, but then was notified that they purchased an XXXX  policy for me and included it in the escrow. I was unaware of this until the loan was transferred to Rushmore Servicing. At that time, Rushmore Servicing continued to escrow for the XXXX  policy knowing the policy was covered under my HOA ( XXXX XXXX ) since the inception of the loan in XXXX XXXX. 

I have spoken to several Rushmore Servicing agents, escrow department, insurance department and loss mitigation department over the year to update my policy, but unfortunately, that has not occurred. Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with customer service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Starting XX/XX/year> every time I Iogin to the capital one Mobile app to view my account, I was asked for a one time PIN ( Two factor authentication ). I have been using the exact same device ( my mobile phone ) and accessed the account using the same network at my house which I have been using prior to XX/XX/year>. I still continued to be asked a one time pin even after successful authentication. 

I had to login multiple times on my mobile app on XX/XX/year> since my transaction using a Virtual card tied to an account reported for fraud was getting rejected. I was also working with one of the agents to resolve the issue. After a few attempts my request for getting a One time pin on the mobile app was blocked with a message that I have exceeded the number of attempts to get a One time pin for the day. I was prompted to wait for 24 hours to get a PIN. This meant all my access to my accounts from the Capital one app was blocked. I have 2 Credit card accounts, 1 Savings account and 2 CDs with Capital One. I wouldn't have access to these accounts for more than 24 hours. I called their customer service. Some of the agents didn't show any empathy and just replied that I need to wait for 24 hours. This seemed a bit scary me not having visibility into my financials on a weekend for 24 hours.

One of the agents suggested I access the account through a browser instead of the app. Again this required me to authenticate on the mobile app. I was finally able to login to my account from a browser after verifying on my mobile app. I felt this ridiculous since my account access was blocked from my mobile app but I could use the app to authenticate and access my account on a browser. Every agent I spoke to mentioned that these are security features taken to protect my account. I found this more of an inconvenience for the customer. Also how could this be protection if the mobile app was used to authenticate me to access my account from a browser. 

It has been close to 24 hours since I accessed my account from my mobile app. This has caused a lot of inconvenience for me performing some of the financial updates during the weekend.

I as the owner of the account 1. Never requested the bank to setup a One time PIN always to access my account.

2. Was never told that there would be a " THRESHOLD '' on the number of times I can access my account from the mobile app since this was tied to the number of one time pins I can generate in a day. 

The customer service agents I spoke to was NOT very helpful and none of them were able to assist me even after authenticating my identity multiple times.
